Use a long, memorable passphrase.
This is the master key to your passwords. It should be easy for you to remember but hard for others to guess.
Example: "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog"
The unique identifier for the site or service (e.g., example.com). This helps generate different passwords for different sites.
Choose a length between 8 and 64 characters. Longer passwords are generally more secure but some sites have limits on password length.
Some sites have restrictions on special characters. Choose the appropriate option based on the site's requirements.
Increment the revision number if you need to change your password for a site. This will generate a new password while keeping the same passphrase and site identifier.
